subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] Where's everyone gone?
msgSnippet: ... Michael: I  will be fascinated to learn if Mr. Read achieved any fame (notoriety?) in his home village for his inspired development of QS.   I am afraid it
messageBody:
Michael:

I  will be fascinated to learn if Mr. Read achieved any fame (notoriety?) in his home village for his inspired development of QS.   I am afraid it will be as Jesus commented regarding a prophet's reputation in his own town.

Regarding uploading additional QS readings:  I have to solve the problem of my current computer system and Truetype fonts.  I am using a hybrid Linux/Windows setup, and I can't access the internet from the Windows side of the computer.  I believe I have to get some type of program to permit Linux to work with the truetype fonts.  Someone mentioned there is a way to do this, but I am not sure I still have a copy of the e-mail.  If anyone knows about this, I would like to have more information about how to get this to work.

Paige
 
 

 Still here... had a bit of a break for my hols, but
before that I was writing a (small) page of
Quickscript every day (for about 3 weeks).

Now I'm back and I'm struggling a bit to get back into
it. Back into Quickscript, and work, and getting up at
6:15 again.

Anyone planning to upload anymore files with texts?
It's good practice for me reading stuff that I haven't
written myself.

The only other news I have is that I realised my Mum
lives in the village next to Mr Read's  - he was in
Abbot's Morton and Mum's in Bishampton - it gets a
mention in the Quickscript book as people couldn't
(and still can't) agree as to whether it should be
pronounced Bish'ampton or Bish Hampton. I asked her
see if there were any Kingsley monuments(!) in the
village, but haven't heard back yet.

Anyway, can't be doing with that 'array' 'urge' stuff.

slán,
Michael
